content.description:
Climb the wall right of

Red Streak

up to the jug rail, then top out as for

Red Streak

.
Climb the right side of the red streak on small holds, up to the big chalked hold. Then go out right onto huge jugs and up to top.
content.protection: Pad(s). Getting down might be tricky, but you go right, and downclimb a ramp with some jugs.
content.location: This is in the middle of the boulder.

content.description:
This highball slab is not actually on the Jug Boulder but rather just to the left of it on the big, obvious ramp. It is high and tricky, and it has been called the best slab problem on the mountain.

Go up the slab using pebbles and tiny edges, and then finish by stepping off to the right when you reach the ledge. High and classic!

Climb the jagged offwidth between

The Ramp

and the Jug by any means necessary. While this may be a desperate mid-route exit for someone who isn't having fun on

The Ramp

, rest assured that it isn't fun either, unless you're into this kind of thing.

By the way, enjoy the crotch rest after the crux.
content.protection: A pad isn't needed, as you're more likely to get stuck than fall off.

content.description: Climb the left side of the red streak.  Instead of moving right to the obvious jug, continue straight up on pebbles....  Technically, the hardest moves are gaining the horizontal hold at the top of the red streak.  Stand on this hold and prepare for the mental crux.  The moves are not bad, but it's high enough to be scary!
content.protection: Pads and a spot.  There is a good landing, but you probably don't want to fall from the top....
content.location: This is the direct variation to the Red Streak.
